content.headline: You Didn’t Sell NIO Stock in May? There’s Still Time to Run Away.
content.summary: Trade tensions can take a major toll on China-based electric vehicle manufacturer Nio (NYSE:NIO). The last thing you need to do in 2024 is add problems to your portfolio, so we’re assigning Nio stock a “D” grade and not recommending it today. Nio is focusing on a specific type of EV-battery technology. The company isn’t hedging its bets, and Nio’s success in this battery-tech bet is uncertain. Despite the Nio share price decline, there is a high risk of further losses. Nio’s Battery-Swap Gambit

content.headline: Chinese EV Maker NIO Partners With Melexis For Advanced Sensor Technology
content.summary: China EV maker NIO Inc (NYSE:NIO) has chosen Melexis' cutting-edge current sensor chips for their traction inverter systems. These advanced chips, tailored for the challenging environment of electric motor control, will be integrated into all of NIO's battery electric vehicles (BEVs). Melexis, based in Belgium, is a supplier of semiconductor solutions primarily focused on designing and delivering sensors for automotive and industrial applications. This collaboration enables NIO to leverage Melex

content.headline: Rent the Runway earnings, jobs, mortgage data: What to watch
content.summary: Yahoo Finance's Jared Blikre and Julie Hyman break down what to watch on Thursday, June 6th. Autodesk (ADSK), J.M Smucker (SJM), NIO (NIO), DocuSign (DOCU), RH (RH), and Rent the Runway (RENT) are all expected to report earnings. Initial Jobless Claims data will be released, with analysts expecting that number to raise slightly to 220,000 from 219,000. New mortgage data is also set to be released.
